text: Margaritaria is a plant genus of the family Phyllanthaceae first published as a genus in 1782.Linnaeus, Carl von Jr. 1782. Supplementum Plantarum 66-67, 428.Tropicos, Margaritaria L.f. It is the smallest pantropical genus of the Phyllanthaceae and, formerly, of the Euphorbiaceae, widely distributed in tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, Australia, North and South America, and various oceanic islands.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesGovaerts, R., Frodin, D.G. & Radcliffe-Smith, A. (2000). World Checklist and Bibliography of Euphorbiaceae (and Pandaceae) 1-4: 1-1622.
